name: Project Night
description:
Come and code with us!

Project Night is a free-form event where you can meet, socialize, and collaborate on projects with other members of Boston's Ruby and Rails communities!

Rubyists of all levels are welcome and encouraged to attend.

• If you're an experienced developer, you'll have a chance to meet others, and catch up on the latest Ruby and Rails tech.

• If you're new to development, we'll have people there who can get you up and running and show you the ropes.

Even if you haven't installed Ruby yet, bring your laptop and we'll send you home with a fully functional Ruby and Rails development environment!

If you have an idea for a short presentation or workshop you'd like to do at Project night, please send an email to [masked]!

We'd also like to thank thoughtbot (https://thoughtbot.com) for providing us with food, drinks, and their space.
how_to_find_us: The office is located between the Downtown Crossing and Park St. T stations.

name: Employer Panel
description:
Happy (almost) Spring!

For the month of April, we bring to you our first ever Employer Panel!

Whether you're looking for your first Ruby job or your tenth, it can be insightful to learn what our local Ruby/Rails shops are looking for in their candidates and what their interview processes are like. Do they accept blind applications? Are there whiteboarding problems? Are there opportunities to work with other tech?

All these questions and more could be answered, but we'd like to know what YOU'RE curious about. Let us know what you'd like to hear by filling out this form: https://goo.gl/forms/fX6RXkhtogszcMF02. We'll also open up the floor for questions towards the end of the evening.

Our evening will be as follows (subject to change):

* 6:00p - Doors open, eat, drink
* 6:20p - Intro to Boston Ruby Group
* 6:30p - Intro to our panelists
* 6:45p - Pre-submitted questions
* 8:00p - Open Q&A
* 8:30p - Happy Hour (sponsored by Wellframe)

And these are our panelists:

* Beth Bader, Software Engineer @ Consider
* Matt Bellantoni, CTO @ ezCater
* Josh Clayton, Development Director @ thoughtbot
* Steff Kelsey, Director of Engineering @ Notarize
* Mike Toppa, Engineering Lead @ ActBlue
* Cindy Tran, Lead Engineer @ LevelUp

We'd also like to thank ezCater (https://www.ezcater.com/) again for hosting our event and providing food and drinks!
